name: Trackingfilter
tagline: Simple end-user monitoring for JEE web applications
body: # TrackingFilter Simple end-user monitoring for Java EE web applications. TrackingFilter is an implementation of Java EE HTTP Servlet Filter. This servlet filter tracks the following: * End-user performance, behavior * HTTP request performance, errors, exceptions * HTTP header, request parameters and attributes * JVM context such as CPU, memory, GC The output can be streamed to any of the TNT4J sinks: file, log4j, socket, visual analysis using jkoolcloud.com (http://www.jkoolcloud.com). ## Adding Tracking to your web applications Simply add the following to your application's `web.xml`: ```xml TrackingFilter org.tnt4j.servlet.filter.TrackingFilter TrackingFilter /* op-level DEBUG ``` NOTE: Make sure all jar files required by `TrackingFilter` are in your application's classpath. # Project Dependencies TrackingFilter requires the following: * JDK 1.6+ * TNT4J (https://github.com/Nastel/TNT4J) # Available Integrations * TNT4J (https://github.com/Nastel/TNT4J) * Log4J (http://logging.apache.org/log4j/1.2/) * jkoolcloud.com (https://www.jkoolcloud.com) * AutoPilot M6 (http://www.nastel.com/products/autopilot-m6.html)
